results.title: Coelenterates (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Biomedia Associates and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Focuses on a hydra capturing a daphnia. Compares the reproduction methods of the hydra and obelia. Shows closeups of the physalia and limestone producing polyps in stony corals. Written and photographed by Bruce J. Russell.

results.title: Arthropods: millipedes, centipedes, crustaceans... (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell and Biomedia Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Of the eight animal species that of the arthropoda is the largest and biologically most successful. Using microphotography the film briefly but clearly explains various functions and activities of some members of the species. An up-close and personal look at millipedes, centipedes, crustaceans, arachnids and insects.

results.title: Annelids (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell, Biomedia Associates and Modern Learning Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
A small anaesthetised earthworm is shown dissected, featuring the pumping heart. Shows peristaltic contractions which mix the food and send it along the intestinal tract. Undigested “castings” are expelled and their importance in soil ecology is discussed.

results.title: Watch your step
results.creator_credit: Basic Films and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Safety”
An accident prevention film with special reference to the building industry. This film re-creates, from actual records, some of the more common accidents and points out the ways in which they could have been avoided.

results.title: Return of Milton Whitty
results.creator_credit: Don Haldane, Peter Alford, Lee Gordon, Construction Safety Assoc of Ontario and Westminster Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Safety”.
A new safety officer in a building construction company meets opposition when he introduces a new safety program. He explains the importance of safety measures. Another in the Milton Whitty Safety series in which he has a new safety problem. A short-sighted foreman who thinks he knows all the answers. He does, except for one. And that is how to prevent accidents. Only when tragedy strikes does he realise that “an ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Haldane, Peter Alford, Lee Gordon, Construction Safety Assoc of Ontario and Westminster Films

results.title: The Inner mind of Milton Whitty
results.creator_credit: Don Haldane, Peter Alford, Lee Gordon and Westminster Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Safety”.
Deals with the fundamental question - “Whose responsibility is safety?” Asked to prepare a speech on safety, Whitty is forced to take a candid look at his performance in accident prevention. In a dream sequence, he is brought to trial and his jury and witnesses are from work and home. This fantasy provides for some statements which will find their application in the safety experience of most companies.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Haldane, Peter Alford, Lee Gordon and Westminster Films

results.title: Risk and forecasting
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
Shows how an analysis of all sources of industrial risks must be taken into account to ensure that enterprise is successful and long-living.

results.title: Quality control
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
Industry controls the quality of its product by keeping a check on the variable factors in manufacturing; men, machines, materials, manufacturing conditions, etc. This film describes factors in setting quality standards on manufacturing cost and selling price.
